questions.question_text: A developer performs a review on a complex process stored in a single .xaml file. During the review, the developer discovers that the workflow cannot be easily tested. Based on best practices, which approach is recommended for improving the ability to independently test components?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Split the project into multiple workflows and use arguments when needed

Selected Answer: B
Go with B.

Selected Answer: B
'B. Split the project into multiple workflows and use arguments when needed

B. Split the project into multiple workflows and use arguments when needed. 

This is the recommended approach for improving the ability to independently test components. Breaking a complex process down into smaller, more manageable workflows makes it easier to test individual components and isolate errors. By using arguments to pass data between workflows, you can also make the process more flexible and reusable. This approach aligns with the best practice of modularizing processes for better maintainability and scalability.

choices.C: Test only the activities that have shown previous errors and modify those activities
choices.A: Place the entire workflow into a single sequence and perform start-to-finish debugging
choices.D: Place the entire project on GIT and use libraries instead of built-in activities
choices.B: Split the project into multiple workflows and use arguments when needed

questions.question_text:
A developer created a custom rule for Workflow Analyzer and wants to make it available only at the project level.
Which action should the developer perform?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A escala de proyecto
Para que las reglas personalizadas estén disponibles solo para un proyecto determinado, crea un paquete NuGet (.nupkg) e instálalo en un proyecto de Studio como dependencia, como se detalla aquí.https://docs.uipath.com/es/activities/other/latest/developer/building-workflow-analyzer-rules

Selected Answer: D
To make custom rules available only for a certain project, create a NuGet package (.nupkg) and install it in a Studio project as a dependency

Selected Answer: D
Add Rules to Studio
Custom Workflow Analyzer rules can be integrated in Studio in two ways:

at global level by adding the external assembly (.dll) in the Studio install location
at project level by installing the custom activities pack.

At Project Level
To make custom rules available only for a certain project, create a NuGet package (.nupkg) and install it in a Studio project as a dependency, as detailed here.

https://docs.uipath.com/developer/other/latest/developer-guide/building-workflow-analyzer-rules

questions.question_text: In UiPath Studio, what describes project validation and workflow analysis?

discussion.content: La validación del archivo o proyecto se realiza cada vez que se lanza el Analizador de flujo de trabajo. Las opciones de validación están disponibles en el botón de cinta Analizar archivo, Validar archivo y Validar proyecto.https://docs.uipath.com/es/studio/standalone/2023.4/user-guide/about-workflow-analyzer

Selected Answer: A
A is better match

Selected Answer: A
Validation of the file or project is performed whenever the Workflow Analyzer is triggered. Validation options are available in the Analyze File ribbon button, Validate File and Validate Project.
